text: Frederick Law Olmsted (April 26, 1822 â€“ August 28, 1903) was an American landscape architect, journalist, social critic, and public administrator. He is considered to be the father of American landscape architecture. He helped Calvert Vaux design Central Park in New York City."F. L Olmsted is Dead; End Comes to Great Landscape Architect at Waverly, Mass. Designer of Central and Prospect Parks and Other Famous Garden Spots of American Cities." New York Times. August 29, 1903. Later he designed many parks. ==References== Category:1822 births Category:1903 deaths Category:American journalists Category:American architects
title: Frederick Law Olmsted
